intro: Didymocarpus stenanthos, commonly known as the narrow-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Didymocarpus stenanthos is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
